unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Spark Festive Cheer**
normalised: Energy and Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Spark Festive Cheer

unnormalised: Good news for homeowners in Kerala planning to go solar! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) has announced a renewed push for rooftop solar subsidies just in time for Onam!
normalised: Good news for homeowners in Kerala planning to go solar! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E) has announced a renewed push for rooftop solar subsidies just in time for Onam!

unnormalised: Think about it - imagine powering your festive lights and even your cooking appliances with clean, green energy. The subsidy, available through empanelled vendors, covers up to 40% of the installation cost for systems up to 3 kW.
normalised: Think about it - imagine powering your festive lights and even your cooking appliances with clean, green energy. The subsidy, available through empanelled vendors, covers up to forty percent of the installation cost for systems up to three kilowatt.

unnormalised: Larger systems (3kW to 10kW) get a reduced but still significant subsidy. Don't worry, even apartment complexes in Mumbai are eligible.
normalised: Larger systems (three kilowatt to ten kilowatt) get a reduced but still significant subsidy. Don't worry, even apartment complexes in Mumbai are eligible.

unnormalised: Reports suggest that early birds get the worm, so jump in early. Imagine, enjoying a plate of delicious biryani on a sun-powered stove!
normalised: Reports suggest that early birds get the worm, so jump in early. Imagine, enjoying a plate of delicious biryani on a sun-powered stove!

unnormalised: Tata Power and Adani Solar are reported to be major players involved in these installations. Check out your DISCOM (distribution company) website for details on eligibility and empanelled vendors.
normalised: Tata Power and Adani Solar are reported to be major players involved in these installations. Check out your D I S C O M (distribution company) website for details on eligibility and empanelled vendors.

unnormalised: The government aims to add another 10,000 MW of rooftop solar capacity by the end of FY24, so do your part and soak up the sun – and the subsidy! This could save you some serious Rs. on your electricity bill in the long run!
normalised: The government aims to add another ten thousand megawatt of rooftop solar capacity by the end of F Y twenty four, so do your part and soak up the sun – and the subsidy! This could save you some serious rupees on your electricity bill in the long run!
